title: TCS Q3 Results LIVE: Tata Consultancy Services to report earnings today, shares rise - Upstox
summary:
TCS Q3 Results LIVE

Date: January 9, 2025

Source: Tata Consultancy Services

Shares of TCS were trading at ₹4,126, reflecting a gain of 0.44%, on the NSE. The latest October-December quarter results will be announced post market hours.

  • Market capitalisation stands at ₹14,96,169.64 crore.
  • Shares rose by 0.65% to ₹4,135.25 apiece.
  • Analysts predict flat revenue between ₹64,150 to ₹64,250 crore due to higher furloughs.
  • Potential net profit growth of 3%-4% to between ₹12,280 and ₹12,350 crore is expected.
The company has informed the Exchange about a Board Meeting to consider quarterly results and dividend.

Overall, anticipation around TCS's earnings report continues to create positive market sentiment.
newTitle: TCS Q3 Results Live: Earnings Announcement and Market Updates

title: Tirupati stampede: President Murmu, PM Modi condole death of devotees - The Hindu
summary:
Tirupati Stampede Tragedy: President and PM Express Condolences

Date: January 09, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

A stampede at the Lord Venkateswara Swamy temple in Tirupati resulted in the deaths of at least six devotees and injuries to dozens more as they jostled for tickets during the Vaikunta Dwara Darshanam.

  • At least six devotees lost their lives in the incident.
  • Dozens were injured and are currently being treated.
  • President Droupadi Murmu expressed her condolences and sympathy for the bereaved and prayed for the injured's recovery.
  • Prime Minister Narendra Modi also offered condolences and stated that the AP Government is providing assistance to those affected.
"Distressed to know that a stampede in Tirupati led to loss of life of many devotees. I extend my heartfelt condolences to the bereaved families and pray for speedy recovery of the injured." - President Droupadi Murmu
"Pained by the stampede in Tirupati, Andhra Pradesh. My thoughts are with those who have lost their near and dear ones. I pray that the injured recover soon." - PM Narendra Modi

This tragic event highlights the need for better crowd management and safety measures during large gatherings at places of worship.
newTitle: Tirupati Stampede Tragedy: President and PM Express Condolences

Pakistan Cricket Board Responds After Report Says Champions Trophy May Move Out Of Pakistan Due To T.. - NDTV Sports
summary:
Pakistan Cricket Board Responds After Report Says Champions Trophy May Move Out Of Pakistan Due To This Reason

Publication Date: December 20, 2024

Source: NDTV

The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has relocated the ODI tri-series from Multan to Karachi and Lahore, addressing concerns over venue readiness for the Champions Trophy. The renovation work at key stadiums is reportedly on track, despite social media reports of delays.

  • The ODI tri-series involves Pakistan, South Africa, and New Zealand.
  • The Champions Trophy is set to begin on February 19 in Karachi.
  • PCB emphasizes confidence in the upgraded venues for hosting international matches.
  • Concerns remain about the completion of renovation work at several stadiums.
  • Upgrades at Gaddafi Stadium have increased its capacity to 35,000.
  • New LED lights have been installed to improve broadcast quality.
“It’s a no-brainer on what would happen if PCB misses deadlines and venues don't meet ICC checklist. Tournament can't be played at semi-ready venues.”

The PCB collaborates with the ICC to ensure all venues meet the required standards ahead of the tournament, stressing the importance of timely completion of all preparations.
newTitle: Pakistan Cricket Board Addresses Concerns Over Champions Trophy Venue Readiness

title: No one has to worry, says Maharashtra Health Minister Abitkar on HMPV - Business Standard
summary:
Maharashtra Health Minister Assures Public About HMPV Concerns

Publication Date: Recent

Source: Business Standard

Maharashtra Health Minister Prakash Abitkar has reassured the public that there is no cause for alarm regarding the Human metapneumovirus (HMPV), stating that the health department is effectively managing the situation.

  • Minister Abitkar described the current variant of HMPV as not strong, drawing parallels to past health crises like the COVID-19 pandemic.
  • Five cases of HMPV have been reported in India, with specific cases located in Bengaluru, Ahmedabad, and Nagpur.
  • WHO official Margaret Harris noted that the rise in respiratory infections during winter and spring is typical and manageable.
  • Federal Health Minister JP Nadda also emphasized that there is no cause for alarm and that health systems are well-prepared.
“No one has to worry...” - Prakash Abitkar, Maharashtra Health Minister

The government is monitoring the situation closely, ensuring that health surveillance networks are on alert for any potential challenges posed by HMPV.
newTitle: Maharashtra Health Minister Assures Public About HMPV Concerns

72-year-old cancer patient in Bengaluru dies by suicide after being declined Ayushman Bharat scheme benefit: Report - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bengaluru Cancer Patient Dies by Suicide After Denied Ayushman Bharat Benefits

Date: December 25, 2023

Source: Hindustan Times

A 72-year-old Bengaluru resident died by suicide after being declined coverage under the Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (AB PM-JAY) for treatment of gastric cancer.

  • The patient learned that he would not receive the promised ₹5 lakh benefit just 15 days after his cancer diagnosis.
  • The Kidwai Memorial Institute Of Oncology denied treatment benefits, citing that state government orders had not arrived.
  • Initial scans cost ₹20,000, and further chemotherapy sessions were planned.
  • The Karnataka government is yet to implement the AB PM-JAY senior citizen scheme.
“We planned on starting two rounds of chemo at Kidwai itself. We were ready to pay, but then we lost him to suicide in just two days.”

This tragic incident highlights the urgent need for better implementation of healthcare schemes to support vulnerable populations.
newTitle: Bengaluru Cancer Patient Dies by Suicide After Denied Ayushman Bharat Benefits

India's Champions Trophy Squad: BCCI Eyeing Star Who's Been Out Of Action For 417 Days, Jasprit Bumr.. - NDTV Sports
summary:
India's Champions Trophy Squad: BCCI Eyeing Star Who's Been Out Of Action For 417 Days, Jasprit Bumrah Uncertain

Publication Date: November 2, 2023 Source: NDTV

The announcement for the Champions Trophy squad is set for January 12, ahead of the tournament starting on February 19, 2024. This article discusses the uncertain status of star players like Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Shami, who is eyeing a return after a lengthy absence.

  • Champions Trophy starts on February 19, 2024, with India's first match on February 20.
  • Mohammed Shami, absent for 417 days since November 19, 2023, is expected to return after ankle surgery and complications.
  • Shami's fitness is being monitored by the BCCI, with a clearance required from the NCA.
  • Jasprit Bumrah's participation is uncertain due to a back injury sustained during the fifth Test against Australia.
  • Michael Clarke praised Bumrah as possibly the greatest all-format fast bowler ever.
"I know a lot of great fast bowlers, Curtly Ambrose, Glenn McGrath, didn't get to play T20 cricket, so I'm not talking about those guys, but in regards to anyone who has played all three formats, I think he might be the best ever." - Michael Clarke

This discussion highlights the potential make-up of India's squad for the prestigious tournament, emphasizing the importance of player fitness and selections.
newTitle: India's Champions Trophy Squad: BCCI Eyeing Star Who's Been Out Of Action For 417 Days, Jasprit Bumrah Uncertain

Amid concerns, WHO official says HMPV virus 'expected during winter' - Business Standard
summary:
WHO Addresses HMPV Virus Concerns Ahead of Winter

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Business Standard

Amid concerns surrounding the Human metapneumovirus (HMPV), WHO official Margaret Harris indicated that the rise in common respiratory infections is expected during winter and spring.

  • Margaret Harris reported a rise in respiratory infections in China, describing it as typical for the winter season.
  • Common pathogens include influenza, respiratory syncytial virus (RSV), HMPV, and SARS-CoV-2.
  • China's reported levels of respiratory infections are within the normal range for this season.
  • The test positivity rate for seasonal influenza was over 30% among patients with flu-like symptoms by the end of December.
  • Precautionary measures to avoid infection are similar to those used during the Covid-19 pandemic.
“According to the Chinese CDC data, the pathogens causing these infections are known ones.” - Margaret Harris

In conclusion, the rise in respiratory infections is normal for this time of year, and precautions remain essential to avoid illness.
newTitle: WHO Addresses HMPV Virus Concerns Ahead of Winter
